Definition: Ethereum's proof-of-stake mechanism securing blocks coordinating validators and finalizing transactions
Examples: Beacon Chain, Prysm, Lighthouse, Teku, Nimbus

Definition: The computational environment that executes smart contracts and updates network state.
Examples: EVM, Geth, Nethermind, Erigon, Besu, Reth

Definition: Entities that stake ETH propose and attest blocks and secure the network.
Examples: Lido, Rocket Pool, Ethereum StakeWise, Kiln, Puffer Finance

Definition: Systems optimizing transaction ordering preventing frontrunning and maximizing network efficiency
Protocol-level improvements enabling scalability security and performance.
Scaling systems batching transactions with fraud-proof mechanisms for cheap fast execution.
Rollups verifying transactions with zero-knowledge proofs for high security and instant finality.
Examples: zkSync, Starknet, Scroll, Polygon zkEVM, Linea, Soneium

Definition: Customizable rollup environments allowing applications to run their own sovereign chains.
Examples: OP Stack, Arbitrum Orbit, ZK Stack

Definition: Infrastructure enabling cross-chain communication and liquidity flow.
Layers providing scalable storage and verification for L2 rollups.
Fiat-backed digital dollars used for payments collateral and settlement.
Crypto-native stablecoins backed by on-chain collateral or algorithmic mechanisms.
Stable assets derived through hedging or tokenized yield.
Gateways for converting fiat into stablecoins or crypto.
APIs enabling enterprises and fintechs to integrate stablecoin flows.
Examples: Circle API, Coinbase Pay, Fireblocks Payments

Definition: Local fiat access and remittance solutions.
DeFi credit markets enabling borrowing and lending using crypto collateral.
Decentralized trading venues and liquidity layers enabling permissionless swaps.
Protocols offering fixed/variable yield interest-rate swaps or automated strategies.
Tokenized staked ETH usable as collateral across DeFi.
Using staked ETH to secure external services for additional yield.
Protocols offering synthetic assets and decentralized derivatives.
Services enabling apps and wallets to read/write blockchain data.
Examples: Alchemy, Infura, QuickNode, Chainstack, Ankr, Helius

Definition: External data feeds used by smart contracts for pricing proofs and computation.
Networks that store relay data and enable efficient verification.
Tools that turn raw on-chain data into queryable formats.
Platforms analyzing wallets flows markets and fundamentals.
Examples: Dune, Nansen, Arkham, Token Terminal, Glassnode

Definition: On-chain agents capable of executing transactions and strategies autonomously.
Tokenized treasuries credit and financial instruments anchored on Ethereum.
Decentralized identifiers and social networks built on Ethereum.
Decentralized networks for compute storage mapping and wireless.
Systems enabling verifiable compute for AI and rollups.
Tools governing proposals voting treasuries and multi-sig operations.
Examples: Aragon, Tally, Snapshot, Safe, OZ Defender

Definition: Corporate and government platforms using Ethereum for settlement and automation.
Government-led digital currency or tokenization initiatives built on Ethereum.
Examples: EU MICA pilots, MAS (Singapore), Brazil CBDC, UAE mBridge

Definition: Platforms ensuring that institutions can use Ethereum while meeting regulatory APIs.
Secure MPC and bank-grade custody for institutions.
